report_title: Big Hat Group Weekly Security Update Report
report_description: The Weekly Security Update Report is provided by Big Hat Group with the goal of making it easier to find the information System Administrators and Security Professionals need to keep their systems secure. The CVE Weekly Report is provided as a beta resource.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2024-21351 Windows SmartScreen Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: The Windows SmartScreen Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability (CVE-2024-21351) affects various Windows versions. The vulnerability allows an attacker to bypass the SmartScreen user experience by injecting code into SmartScreen, potentially leading to data exposure and system unavailability. The attack vector is network-based, requiring no privileges, but user interaction is needed to open a malicious file. Successful exploitation could result in some loss of confidentiality, total loss of integrity, and some loss of availability. Microsoft has provided an official fix through security updates for affected Windows versions, addressing the moderate severity issue. System administrators are advised to apply the security updates promptly to mitigate the risk of exploitation. For more details, refer to the Microsoft Security Response Center page.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2024-21357 Windows Pragmatic General Multicast (PGM) Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Windows Pragmatic General Multicast (PGM) is affected by a Critical Remote Code Execution vulnerability identified as CVE-2024-21357. The vulnerability has a CVSS score of 8.1/7.1 and can be exploited remotely over the network without user interaction. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending specially crafted malicious traffic to a vulnerable server. The attack complexity is high, requiring the attacker to invest effort in preparation. The impact includes total loss of confidentiality, integrity, and availability. Microsoft has provided an official fix for various Windows versions, including Windows Server 2012, 2008, 2016, 2019, and multiple versions of Windows 10 and 11. System administrators are advised to apply the security updates promptly to mitigate the risk of remote code execution.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2024-21344 Windows Network Address Translation (NAT) Denial of Service Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: A Denial of Service vulnerability (CVE-2024-21344) affecting Windows Network Address Translation (NAT) has been identified with a CVSS score of 5.9/5.2. The vulnerability is network-bound, requiring no user interaction, and has a high attack complexity. An attacker could exploit this remotely exploitable vulnerability to fully deny access to resources, impacting availability. Microsoft has provided an official fix for various Windows versions including Windows Server 2012 R2, Windows Server 2016, Windows 10, Windows 11, and Windows Server 2022. System administrators are advised to apply the respective security updates to mitigate the risk of exploitation. The exploit code maturity is unproven, and the remediation level indicates the availability of a complete vendor solution. The attack vector complexity implies additional actions are needed for successful exploitation, enhancing the urgency of applying the provided security updates.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2024-21354 Microsoft Message Queuing (MSMQ) Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Microsoft Message Queuing (MSMQ) is affected by an Elevation of Privilege vulnerability identified as CVE-2024-21354. The vulnerability has a CVSS score of 7.8/6.8, indicating a high impact. The attack vector is local, requiring no user interaction, with low attack complexity and privileges required. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to gain SYSTEM privileges. Microsoft has provided an official fix for this vulnerability. The affected products include various Windows Server versions and Windows client versions like Windows 10 and 11. System administrators are advised to apply the provided security updates to mitigate the risk of exploitation. For more details and specific build numbers, refer to the Microsoft Security Update Guide.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2024-21352 Microsoft WDAC OLE DB provider for SQL Server Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Microsoft WDAC OLE DB provider for SQL Server is affected by a Remote Code Execution Vulnerability identified as CVE-2024-21352. The vulnerability allows an attacker to execute arbitrary code remotely by tricking an authenticated user into connecting to a malicious SQL server via OLEDB, leading to the server receiving a malicious networking packet. The attack vector is network-based, and user interaction is required. The impact includes high confidentiality, integrity, and availability risks. Microsoft has provided an official fix for this vulnerability through security updates for various Windows Server versions and Windows 10/11 versions. System administrators are advised to apply the relevant security updates promptly to mitigate the risk of exploitation. The attacker's success does not require specialized access conditions or privileges, making it crucial to address this vulnerability promptly to prevent potential remote code execution attacks.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2024-21351 Windows SmartScreen Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Windows SmartScreen in various Windows versions is susceptible to a Security Feature Bypass vulnerability identified as CVE-2024-21351. The vulnerability allows an attacker to bypass the SmartScreen user experience by injecting malicious code. Exploitation requires user interaction, where an authorized attacker must send a malicious file and convince the user to open it. Successful exploitation could result in some loss of confidentiality, total loss of integrity, and some loss of availability. The impact includes potential data exposure and system unavailability. Microsoft has provided a security update for affected Windows versions, addressing the vulnerability and mitigating the risk. System administrators are advised to apply the provided security updates to safeguard their systems against this Security Feature Bypass vulnerability.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2024-21350 Microsoft WDAC OLE DB provider for SQL Server Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Microsoft WDAC OLE DB provider for SQL Server is affected by a Remote Code Execution vulnerability (CVE-2024-21350) with a CVSS score of 8.8/7.7. The vulnerability allows an attacker to execute code remotely by tricking an authenticated user into connecting to a malicious SQL server via OLEDB, leading to the server receiving a malicious networking packet. The attack vector is through network exploitation with low complexity and no privileges required. Successful exploitation requires user interaction. The impact includes high confidentiality, integrity, and availability risks. Microsoft has provided an official fix for this vulnerability. System administrators are advised to apply the security updates provided for various Windows Server versions and Windows client systems to mitigate the risk of remote code execution.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2024-21349 Microsoft ActiveX Data Objects Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Microsoft ActiveX Data Objects is impacted by a Remote Code Execution vulnerability (CVE-2024-21349) with a CVSS score of 8.8/7.7. The vulnerability allows an attacker to execute arbitrary code remotely. The attack vector is network-based, requiring no privileges or user interaction. An attacker could exploit this by tricking a victim into connecting to a malicious SQL database, leading to code execution. Microsoft has provided an official fix for this vulnerability. System administrators are advised to apply the security updates released for various Windows Server versions and Windows client systems to mitigate the risk of exploitation. The severity of the vulnerability lies in the potential total loss of confidentiality, integrity, and availability of the impacted systems. The exploitability assessment indicates that exploitation is less likely due to the need for user interaction. The availability of an official patch reduces the urgency of remediation, providing a complete vendor solution to address the vulnerability.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2024-21348 Internet Connection Sharing (ICS) Denial of Service Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: The Internet Connection Sharing (ICS) Denial of Service Vulnerability, identified as CVE-2024-21348, affects various Microsoft products including Windows Server versions, Windows 10, Windows 11, and Windows Server 2022. The vulnerability has a high impact on availability, leading to a total loss of accessibility, allowing attackers to fully deny access to resources. It is remotely exploitable over the network without the need for user interaction or privileges. Microsoft has provided an official fix for this vulnerability through security updates with specific build numbers for each affected product version. System administrators are strongly advised to apply the respective security updates to mitigate the risk of exploitation and ensure the availability of their systems. The exploit code maturity is unproven, and the remediation level indicates that an official fix is available, reducing the urgency for immediate action. The attack vector is network-based, making it critical to address promptly to prevent potential denial of service attacks.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2024-21347 Microsoft ODBC Driver Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Microsoft ODBC Driver is affected by a Remote Code Execution vulnerability (CVE-2024-21347) with a CVSS score of 7.5. The vulnerability allows attackers to execute arbitrary code remotely. The attack vector is through the network, requiring user interaction but no privileges. An attacker can exploit this by tricking a user to connect to a malicious SQL database. Microsoft has provided an official fix for this vulnerability. Affected products include various Windows Server versions, Windows 10, 11, and Windows Server 2019, with corresponding security updates. System administrators are advised to apply the provided security updates to mitigate the risk of remote code execution. The vulnerability's impact includes high confidentiality, integrity, and availability risks, emphasizing the critical nature of this issue for enterprise systems.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2024-21346 Win32k Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: A Win32k Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability, identified as CVE-2024-21346, affects various Windows versions including Windows 11 and Windows Server 2022. The vulnerability allows an attacker to gain SYSTEM privileges. The impact is an elevation of privilege with a maximum severity level of Important. The attack vector is local, with low complexity and privileges required. User interaction is not needed, and the scope is unchanged. The vulnerability results in high confidentiality, integrity, and availability impact. An official fix is available through security updates for the affected Windows versions, including specific build numbers for each. System administrators are advised to apply the provided security updates promptly to mitigate the risk of exploitation and prevent unauthorized privilege escalation.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2024-21343 Windows Network Address Translation (NAT) Denial of Service Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: A Denial of Service vulnerability (CVE-2024-21343) affecting Windows Network Address Translation (NAT) has been identified with a maximum severity rating of Important. The vulnerability is remotely exploitable over the network stack without requiring user interaction, with a high attack complexity. Attackers with no prior privileges can exploit this vulnerability, leading to a total loss of availability. Microsoft has provided an official fix for this issue. Various Windows versions, including Windows Server 2012 R2, Windows Server 2016, Windows 10, Windows 11, Windows Server 2022, and Windows Server 2019, are impacted. System administrators are advised to apply the corresponding security updates to mitigate the risk of exploitation. The exploit code maturity is unproven, and the remediation level indicates the availability of an official fix. The vulnerability has not been publicly disclosed or exploited at the time of publication.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2024-21356 Windows Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP) Denial of Service Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: A Denial of Service vulnerability (CVE-2024-21356) affecting Windows Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP) has been identified with a CVSS score of 6.5. The vulnerability is network-based, requiring low attack complexity and privileges. It does not need user interaction and has a high impact on availability. The vulnerability affects various Windows Server versions and Windows client systems. Microsoft has released official fixes in the form of security updates for impacted systems, including Windows Server 2012, 2016, 2019, and multiple versions of Windows 10 and 11. System administrators are advised to apply the provided security updates promptly to mitigate the risk of exploitation and ensure the availability of the affected systems. The exploit code maturity is unproven, and the remediation level indicates an official fix is available. Microsoft acknowledges the security community's efforts in coordinated vulnerability disclosure.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2024-21342 Windows DNS Client Denial of Service Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: A Denial of Service vulnerability (CVE-2024-21342) affecting Windows DNS Client has been identified with a CVSS score of 7.5. The vulnerability is remotely exploitable over the network without requiring user interaction and does not need any specific privileges. Attackers can fully deny access to resources in the impacted component, leading to a high impact on availability. Microsoft has released security updates for Windows Server 2022, Windows 11 Version 23H2, and Windows 11 Version 22H2 to address this vulnerability. The exploit code maturity is unproven, but an official fix is available, indicating a complete vendor solution. System administrators are advised to apply the provided security updates to mitigate the risk of exploitation and ensure the availability of the affected Windows systems.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2024-21341 Windows Kernel Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: A critical Windows Kernel Remote Code Execution Vulnerability, identified as CVE-2024-21341, has been disclosed by Microsoft. This vulnerability allows for remote code execution with a high impact on confidentiality, integrity, and availability. The attack vector is physical with low complexity and requires no user interaction, making it highly exploitable. The attacker does not need any prior privileges to carry out the attack. Microsoft has provided an official fix for this vulnerability through security updates for various Windows versions, including Windows 10, 11, and Windows Server editions. System administrators are strongly advised to apply the provided security updates promptly to mitigate the risk of exploitation and protect the affected systems from potential remote code execution attacks.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2024-21340 Windows Kernel Information Disclosure Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: A Windows Kernel Information Disclosure Vulnerability (CVE-2024-21340) has been identified with a base CVSS score of 4.6. The vulnerability allows an attacker to read small portions of heap memory, potentially leading to information disclosure. The attack vector is physical, requiring the attacker to physically interact with the vulnerable component. However, no privileges are required for exploitation, and the attack can be executed without user interaction. The impact is limited to confidentiality, with a total loss of confidentiality if exploited. Microsoft has provided an official fix for this vulnerability through security updates for various Windows Server versions, Windows 10, Windows 11, and Windows Server 2019. System administrators are advised to apply the respective security updates to mitigate the risk of information disclosure. The exploit code maturity is unproven, indicating no active exploitation at the time of publication. The remediation level is at the official fix stage, signifying the availability of complete vendor solutions for the vulnerability.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2024-21339 Windows USB Generic Parent Driver Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: A critical Remote Code Execution vulnerability (CVE-2024-21339) affecting Windows USB Generic Parent Driver has been identified and addressed by Microsoft. The vulnerability allows attackers to execute arbitrary code remotely without requiring any user interaction. The attack complexity is high, requiring the attacker to invest effort in preparation or execution. Successful exploitation could lead to total loss of confidentiality, integrity, and availability. Microsoft has released security updates for various Windows versions, including Windows Server and Windows 10/11, to mitigate this vulnerability. System administrators are advised to apply the provided security updates promptly to prevent potential exploitation and secure their systems against remote code execution attacks.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2024-21338 Windows Kernel Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: A Windows Kernel Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability, identified as CVE-2024-21338, has been addressed by Microsoft. The vulnerability allows an attacker to gain SYSTEM privileges by running a specially crafted application after logging into the system. The attack vector is local, with low complexity and no user interaction required. The impact includes high confidentiality, integrity, and availability risks. Microsoft has released security updates for various Windows versions, including Windows Server and Windows 10/11, to mitigate this vulnerability. System administrators are advised to apply the provided security updates promptly to prevent potential exploitation and protect system integrity. The official fix is available, and no known exploitation of this vulnerability has been reported at the time of publication.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2024-21304 Trusted Compute Base Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: A Trusted Compute Base Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability (CVE-2024-21304) affecting various Microsoft products has been identified with a severity level of 'Important'. The vulnerability allows for an elevation of privilege, potentially granting an attacker SYSTEM privileges. The attack vector is local, requiring no user interaction, with high complexity and privileges required. The impact includes a total loss of integrity but no impact on confidentiality or availability. An official fix is available in the form of security updates for affected products like Windows Server 2022, Windows 11, Windows 10, and Windows Server 2019. System administrators are advised to apply the provided security updates promptly to mitigate the risk of exploitation and secure their systems against this elevation of privilege vulnerability.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2024-20684 Windows Hyper-V Denial of Service Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Windows Hyper-V is impacted by a Critical Denial of Service vulnerability identified as CVE-2024-20684. The vulnerability allows a Hyper-V guest to affect the functionality of the Hyper-V host, leading to a total loss of availability. The attack vector is local, requiring no user interaction, with low privileges required for exploitation. Microsoft has provided an official fix through security updates for various Windows versions, including Windows Server 2022 and Windows 11. System administrators are advised to apply the respective security updates to mitigate the risk of exploitation. The exploit code maturity is unproven, but a complete vendor solution is available. The vulnerability has a CVSS base score of 6.5 and a temporal score of 5.7, indicating a critical impact. Microsoft acknowledges the security community for coordinated vulnerability disclosure and provides detailed information on the vulnerability for further reference.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2024-21355 Microsoft Message Queuing (MSMQ) Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Microsoft Message Queuing (MSMQ) is impacted by an Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability identified as CVE-2024-21355. The vulnerability has a high attack complexity, requiring conditions beyond the attacker's control to exploit. An attacker could gain SYSTEM privileges upon successful exploitation. The vulnerability allows for local attack vectors without user interaction. It results in a total loss of confidentiality, integrity, and availability. Microsoft has provided an official fix for this vulnerability. System administrators are advised to apply the security updates released for various Windows Server versions, Windows 10, Windows 11, and Windows Server 2019 and 2022 to mitigate the risk of privilege escalation. The exploitability assessment indicates that the vulnerability is not publicly disclosed or exploited, and an official patch is available. For further details and specific build numbers, refer to the Microsoft Security Update Guide.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2024-21420 Microsoft WDAC OLE DB provider for SQL Server Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Microsoft WDAC OLE DB provider for SQL Server is affected by a Remote Code Execution vulnerability identified as CVE-2024-21420. The vulnerability allows an attacker to execute arbitrary code within the context of the user's SQL client application. The attack vector is network-based, requiring an authenticated victim to connect to a malicious SQL database using their SQL client application. The vulnerability does not require any privileges or user interaction. The impact includes high confidentiality, integrity, and availability risks. Microsoft has provided an official fix for this vulnerability through security updates for various Windows versions, including Windows Server 2016, Windows 10, Windows Server 2022, and Windows 11. System administrators are advised to apply the relevant security updates to mitigate the risk of exploitation and protect their systems from potential remote code execution attacks.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2024-21412 Internet Shortcut Files Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: The Internet Shortcut Files Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability, identified as CVE-2024-21412, affects various Microsoft products including Windows Server, Windows 10, Windows 11, and Windows Server 2022. The vulnerability allows an attacker to bypass security checks by sending a specially crafted file to a user and convincing them to open it. The attack vector is network-based, requiring no privileges or user interaction. Successful exploitation results in high confidentiality and integrity impact. Microsoft has provided a security update to address this vulnerability, with different build numbers for affected systems. System administrators are advised to apply the relevant security updates promptly to mitigate the risk of exploitation.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2024-21369 Microsoft WDAC OLE DB provider for SQL Server Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Microsoft WDAC OLE DB provider for SQL Server is affected by a Remote Code Execution vulnerability identified as CVE-2024-21369 with a CVSS score of 8.8. The vulnerability allows an attacker to execute arbitrary code within the context of the user's SQL client application. Exploitation requires an authenticated victim to connect to a malicious SQL database, enabling specially crafted replies to trigger the vulnerability. The attack vector is network-based, and user interaction is required. The impact includes high confidentiality, integrity, and availability risks. Microsoft has provided an official fix for this vulnerability through security updates for various Windows Server versions and Windows client systems. System administrators are advised to apply the relevant security updates promptly to mitigate the risk of exploitation and protect their systems from potential remote code execution attacks.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2024-21406 Windows Printing Service Spoofing Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Windows Printing Service is affected by a Spoofing vulnerability identified as CVE-2024-21406 with a CVSS score of 7.5. The vulnerability allows an unauthenticated attacker to send a specially crafted packet to a server utilizing the HTTP Protocol Stack. This vulnerability is remotely exploitable over the network without user interaction and requires no special privileges. Successful exploitation could lead to a total loss of integrity, allowing attackers to modify protected files. Microsoft has provided an official fix for this vulnerability through security updates for various Windows versions, including Windows Server and Windows 10. System administrators are advised to apply the relevant security updates to mitigate the risk of exploitation. For more details and specific build numbers, refer to the Microsoft Security Update Guide.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2024-21405 Microsoft Message Queuing (MSMQ) Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Microsoft Message Queuing (MSMQ) is impacted by an Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability identified as CVE-2024-21405 with a CVSS score of 7.0. The vulnerability allows attackers to gain SYSTEM privileges. The attack complexity is high, requiring a race condition to be won. Privileges required for exploitation are low, and user interaction is not needed. The impact includes high confidentiality, integrity, and availability risks. Microsoft has provided an official fix for this vulnerability. System administrators are advised to apply the security updates promptly to mitigate the risk of exploitation. The affected products include various Windows Server versions and Windows client versions like Windows 10 and 11. The vulnerability could lead to unauthorized elevation of privileges, posing a significant security threat to affected systems. Microsoft acknowledges the security community for coordinated vulnerability disclosure and emphasizes the importance of timely patching to protect customer systems.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2024-21391 Microsoft WDAC OLE DB provider for SQL Server Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: The Microsoft WDAC OLE DB provider for SQL Server is affected by a Remote Code Execution vulnerability identified as CVE-2024-21391. The vulnerability has a CVSS score of 8.8/7.7, with a high impact on confidentiality, integrity, and availability. It is remotely exploitable over the network without requiring user privileges. An attacker could execute arbitrary code by tricking an authenticated victim into connecting to a malicious SQL database. Microsoft released security updates in January 2024 to address this issue, which were inadvertently omitted from the initial release but have been rectified. Customers who have installed the January 2024 updates are not required to take further action. System administrators are advised to apply the provided security updates to mitigate the risk of exploitation and protect their systems from potential remote code execution attacks.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2024-21377 Windows DNS Information Disclosure Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Windows DNS Information Disclosure Vulnerability (CVE-2024-21377) has been identified with a maximum severity level of Important. The vulnerability allows attackers to potentially read small portions of heap memory, leading to information disclosure. The attack vector is local, requiring no user interaction, with low privileges required for exploitation. The impact includes high confidentiality and availability risks. Microsoft has provided an official fix for this vulnerability through security updates for various Windows versions, including Windows Server 2012 R2, Windows Server 2016, Windows 10, Windows 11, Windows Server 2022, and Windows Server 2019. System administrators are advised to apply the respective security updates to mitigate the risk of information disclosure. The exploit code maturity is unproven, and the remediation level indicates an official fix is available. The vulnerability affects multiple Windows versions, emphasizing the importance of prompt patching to secure systems against potential attacks.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2024-21375 Microsoft WDAC OLE DB provider for SQL Server Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Microsoft WDAC OLE DB provider for SQL Server is affected by a Remote Code Execution vulnerability (CVE-2024-21375) with a CVSS score of 8.8. The vulnerability allows an attacker to execute arbitrary code remotely by tricking an authenticated user into connecting to a malicious SQL server via OLEDB, leading to the server receiving a malicious networking packet. The attack vector is network-based, requiring user interaction. The impact includes high confidentiality, integrity, and availability risks. Microsoft has provided an official fix for this vulnerability through security updates for various Windows Server versions, Windows 10, Windows 11, and Windows Server 2019. System administrators are advised to apply the relevant security updates promptly to mitigate the risk of exploitation. The attacker's exploitation scenario involves persuading a victim to connect to a malicious SQL database, enabling the execution of arbitrary code within the user's SQL client application. No exploit code is currently available, and the remediation level is marked as 'Official Fix.' User interaction is required for successful exploitation, emphasizing the importance of user awareness and security best practices.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2024-21372 Windows OLE Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Windows systems are affected by a Critical Windows OLE Remote Code Execution Vulnerability identified as CVE-2024-21372. The vulnerability allows remote code execution with a high impact on confidentiality, integrity, and availability. It has a CVSS score of 8.8/7.7. The attack vector is network-based, requiring no privileges or user interaction. An attacker could exploit this by tricking a victim into connecting to a malicious SQL database, leading to arbitrary code execution. Microsoft has provided an official fix for this vulnerability through security updates for various Windows versions, including Windows Server 2012, 2008, and different Windows 10 and 11 versions. System administrators are strongly advised to apply the provided security updates to mitigate the risk of exploitation and protect their systems from potential attacks.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2024-21371 Windows Kernel Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: A Windows Kernel Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability, identified as CVE-2024-21371, has been addressed by Microsoft. The vulnerability allows attackers to elevate privileges to gain SYSTEM access. It has a CVSS score of 7.0, indicating a high severity level. The attack vector is local, requiring no user interaction, with low privileges needed. Successful exploitation depends on conditions beyond the attacker's control. The impact includes high confidentiality, integrity, and availability risks. An official fix is available through security updates for various Windows versions, including Windows Server and Windows 10. System administrators are advised to apply the provided security updates promptly to mitigate the risk of exploitation and protect their systems from potential privilege escalation attacks.

section_1_data.summary: Microsoft WDAC OLE DB provider for SQL Server is affected by a Remote Code Execution vulnerability identified as CVE-2024-21370. section_1_data.summary: Microsoft WDAC OLE DB provider for SQL Server is affected by a Remote Code Execution vulnerability identified as CVE-2024-21366. The attack vector is network-based, requiring an authenticated victim to connect to a malicious SQL database using their SQL client application. The vulnerability is rated as Important with a CVSS score of 8.8. The exploit does not require privileges or user interaction, making it a serious threat. Microsoft has provided an official fix for this vulnerability through security updates for various Windows Server and Windows versions. System administrators are strongly advised to apply the relevant security updates to mitigate the risk of exploitation and protect their systems from potential remote code execution attacks.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2024-21365 Microsoft WDAC OLE DB provider for SQL Server Remote Code Execution Vulnerability

section_1_data.title: CVE-2024-21363 Microsoft Message Queuing (MSMQ) Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Microsoft Message Queuing (MSMQ) is affected by a Remote Code Execution vulnerability identified as CVE-2024-21363, with a CVSS score of 7.8. The vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code without requiring user interaction. The attack vector is local, meaning the attacker needs access to the target system. The exploit does not require elevated privileges, making it accessible to any authenticated attacker. The impact includes high confidentiality, integrity, and availability risks. Microsoft has provided an official fix for this vulnerability through security updates for various Windows Server and Windows client versions. System administrators are advised to apply the relevant security updates promptly to mitigate the risk of exploitation.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2024-21362 Windows Kernel Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: A Windows Kernel Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability, identified as CVE-2024-21362, has been reported with a maximum severity of Important. The vulnerability allows an attacker to bypass the Windows Code Integrity Guard (CIG) and could lead to a major loss of integrity. The attack vector is local, requiring no user interaction, with low privileges required for exploitation. An authenticated attacker could replace valid file content with specially crafted content. Microsoft has provided an official fix through security updates for various Windows versions, including Windows Server and Windows 10, addressing the Security Feature Bypass issue. System administrators are advised to apply the respective security updates to mitigate the vulnerability and protect system integrity. The exploitability assessment indicates that exploitation is less likely, and no exploit has been publicly disclosed at the time of publication. The availability metric suggests no impact on availability within the impacted component, emphasizing the focus on integrity and confidentiality aspects of the vulnerability.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2024-21361 Microsoft WDAC OLE DB provider for SQL Server Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Microsoft WDAC OLE DB provider for SQL Server is impacted by a Remote Code Execution vulnerability identified as CVE-2024-21361. The vulnerability allows an attacker to execute arbitrary code within the context of the user's SQL client application. The attack vector is network-based, requiring an authenticated victim to connect to a malicious SQL database. The vulnerability is rated with a CVSS score of 8.8/7.7, indicating a high impact on confidentiality, integrity, and availability. Microsoft has provided an official fix for this vulnerability through security updates for various Windows Server versions and Windows client systems. System administrators are advised to apply the relevant security updates promptly to mitigate the risk of exploitation. The exploitability assessment indicates that no exploit code is currently available, and the remediation level is classified as having an official fix available. User interaction is required for successful exploitation, emphasizing the importance of user awareness and caution when interacting with SQL databases.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2024-21360 Microsoft WDAC OLE DB provider for SQL Server Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Microsoft WDAC OLE DB provider for SQL Server is affected by a Remote Code Execution vulnerability identified as CVE-2024-21360. The vulnerability allows an attacker to execute arbitrary code within the context of the user's SQL client application. The attack vector is network-based, requiring an authenticated victim to connect to a malicious SQL database. This vulnerability does not require any privileges or user interaction, making it exploitable with low complexity. Successful exploitation results in high impact on confidentiality, integrity, and availability. Microsoft has provided an official fix for this vulnerability through security updates for various Windows Server versions, Windows 10, Windows 11, and Windows Server 2019 and 2022. System administrators are strongly advised to apply the relevant security updates to mitigate the risk of remote code execution.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2024-21359 Microsoft WDAC OLE DB provider for SQL Server Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Microsoft WDAC OLE DB provider for SQL Server is impacted by a Remote Code Execution vulnerability identified as CVE-2024-21359 with a CVSS score of 8.8. The vulnerability allows an attacker to execute arbitrary code within the context of the user's SQL client application. The attack vector is network-based, requiring an authenticated victim to connect to a malicious SQL database. Successful exploitation does not require any privileges or user interaction. The impact includes high confidentiality, integrity, and availability risks. Microsoft has provided an official fix for this vulnerability through security updates for various Windows Server versions, Windows 10, Windows 11, and Windows Server 2022. System administrators are advised to apply the relevant security updates promptly to mitigate the risk of remote code execution.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2024-21357 Windows Pragmatic General Multicast (PGM) Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: A Critical Remote Code Execution vulnerability (CVE-2024-21357) affecting Windows Pragmatic General Multicast (PGM) has been identified and addressed by Microsoft. The vulnerability allows attackers to exploit the network stack remotely without requiring user interaction. An attacker could send specially crafted malicious traffic to a vulnerable server to execute arbitrary code. The attack complexity is high, requiring the attacker to invest effort in preparation. The vulnerability results in total loss of confidentiality, integrity, and availability. Microsoft has released security updates for various Windows versions to mitigate this issue, including Windows Server 2012, 2008, 10, 11, and others. System administrators are advised to apply the official fixes promptly to prevent potential exploitation and ensure system security.
